results.title: Weekend magazine: kite flying festival
results.brief_description: The 1983 Singapore International Kite Festival provided a venue for kite enthusiasts from all over the world. This film features some of the entries, including traditional eastern kites and more innovative designs such as the world’s largest kite which required a huge army truck as an anchor. Also takes a brief historical look at the kite and people’s fascination with it.

results.title: Weekend Magazine: free music
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Rex Clayton
results.brief_description: Explains Percy Grainger’s ideas about free music and shows the machine he had made with the help of Bernard Cross. The machine is very like a synthesizer and was meant to play Grainger’s music, which proved an impossible task for people. A Melbourne Conservatorium expert was the first person to transcribe the music on graphs on to tape, and in Bernard Cross’s presence it was played for the first time publicly.

results.title: Weekend at Cradle Mountain
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Council for Children's Films and Television, Children's Films and Television, Island Film Services, C Wolnizer and W. H. Perkins
results.brief_description: Shows the children of a family spending a weekend at the chalet in Cradle Mountain Reserve going on two long walks past the mountain lakes, life at the chalet, the chalet keeper and the ranger, and their native pets. Cast: Margaret, Marcus and Duncan. Commentary by Nan Chauncey.

results.title: Weekend at Bernies (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Gladden Entertainment, Victor Drai and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Larry and Richard have just discovered a fraud and embezzlement scheme that’s costing the insurance company they work for millions. Their Mafia connected boss Bernie is behind the crime and invites them for a weekend so he can rub them out. After some major bungling, it’s Bernie who ends up dead and Larry and Richard have to convince everyone Bernie is alive. As the tagline states, “for a corpse, Bernie sure gets around.” Cast includes Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart and Terry Kiser.

results.title: Weekend
results.creator_credit: Comacico, Les Films Copernic, Lira Films(Paris), Ascot Cineraid(Rome) and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: In this highly stylised fable, told in Jean-Luc Godard’s inimitable, unique style, a weekend trip from Paris to Normandy turns into an automobile apocalypse and a shattering metaphor for the decline of the West. Photography by Raoul Coutard.

results.title: Weekend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Looks at the behaviour of a group of young teenagers over what is for them a typical weekend. The focus is on the peer group role in their lives and its significance in shaping expectations the boys and girls have of each other. (Includes footage of John Paul Young performing on stage.)

results.title: Week-end fishing = Weekend fishing
results.brief_description: A look at the various forms of fishing in Australia, from the crowded piers in Sydney harbour, to the quiet backwaters, inland streams, and rocky surf beaches. Men and women, young and old, participate in the recreation hoping to enjoy the fruits of their labour at their evening meal.

results.title: Weedy plot
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
One of a series of films which is designed to help bring about a better understanding of how our legal processes work in solving the everyday human conflicts and disputes. This is a case about an employee fired for rudeness. Cast includes Don Pasere, Wendy Playfair, Les Foxcraft, Ken Goodlet.

results.title: Weed
results.creator_credit: Concept Films, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Brian Kellman
results.brief_description: Traces the use of marijuana throughout history. Compares past and present attitudes towards it use. Discusses known physiological and psychological effects, plans for future research into still unanswered questions about these effects, and the social and legal implications of possession.
